name: Monk Deflect Arrows and Epic Dodge
author: Maximillian_Kane

posts.author: Maximillian_Kane
posts.content:
Hail, Mighty ECBers!

I was wondering how these two feats interact with each other when a Monk has them both. I have played the Shadow Priest on WoG to level 40, but there's an item there that Clerics can carry on the off-hand that doesn't mess with Monk Ubab progression or AC, so I never actually found out because you need your off-hand to be free to use Deflect Arrows.

What happens when a Monk receives a ranged attack? Does Epic Dodge trigger first, does Deflect Arrows trigger first, or do they trigger simultaneously? How does it work when both are "active" and usable at the same time? I'd greatly appreciate it if anyone who knows could share this info.

Thanks!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I went to the NWN WIKI articles for Epic Dodge and Deflect Arrow, and the Talk page for Deflect Arrow talks about testing this combination, but no results from such a test were posted, and the Talk page for Epic Dodge makes no mention of this combination.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Should be easy enough to test in Critwall.

I'll test it with my Nightshade.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content: Deflect Arrows triggers first, Epic Dodge triggers second. If both are active then the Monk can potentially block two ranged attacks per round.

posts.content:
